title: @Meddler - Death's Dance and the delayed damage stopping your Recall

replies.body:
I could get behind this. I do think it's a known drawback of the item, so they could balance around it, but I see how that could become troublesome.

On the other hand, it's been so unpopular that I also wouldn't be surprised to see DD removed from the game. I almost never see people build it. Feel free to correct me on the popular builds that use it, but I rarely see it.
I keep seeing high elo streamers trying to recall and they have no idea the item is stopping them XD It's pretty funny.
I was trying to think if I have been affected by it recently... can't remember a time when that might have been happening. It's pretty weird interaction.

It is pretty good on Illaoi along with spirit visage. It gives you sustain on minions.
My usual build on Illaoi : BC>dd>SV>DMP>omen/ga

The healing effect isn't reduced on AoE effects (her tentacles)
all healing affects are reduced for aoe, if its not in the tooltip that is an error.{{item:3812}}  it is in the tooltip
Its one of my favorite things to build on Aatrox, and it is a pretty unique item.
plus aatrox w applies it. unlike lifesteal.

It just doesn't really work with the meta at the moment. The meta is basically who can burst who faster. DD is a sustain survive item that will help against slower incoming damage but isn't gonna do a whole lot to help burst others or keep from popping like a bubble from crazy amounts of burst.

I'm more concerned how you just took damage, and the delayed damage is happening, and you feel the need to recall, despite where the damage came from?

Dragon, random minion, buff camp, anything, it isn't restricted to champions triggering the DoT.   I most notice it after killing Drag and going to recall (Knowing I'm perfectly safe and that at worse I just need to use some ability to hop the wall if somehow an enemy were to rush over).
Say an Ezreal ult's you from halfway across the map or something, or you just finished dueling an opponent and need to back before the enemy Warwick mauls you
